Key Match Events: England lost all 10 wickets for 111 runs
Bairstow clumped a truly miserable shot straight to mid-on
Stokes the man at deep midwicket
Adil Rashid’s departure that best summed up the team’s day
Joe Root ran himself out in search of a nonexistent run
Ben Stokes survived a review when he was yet to score, was nearly caught, brilliantly, at backward square leg on 12
Pre-Game Insights: England wanted to use this game to set a new level of performance
They made three changes for last Saturday’s thrashing by South Africa and there were three more here, with the aim – laughable in hindsight – of bolstering their batting
For the first time in ODIs, and the first time in any format for more than a century, England picked a team without any players younger than 30
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler admits England hit ‘huge low’ in World Cup defeat by Sri Lanka
England’s world champions are no more
It is only a matter of time and the really painful part of their World Cup starts here, with a period of prolonged and perhaps literally pointless torture
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka, 160-2, beat England, 156 all out, by eight wickets
Nissanka’s 77 not out condemns England to fourth defeat
England have now lost four games, their confidence, their reputation and at times it seems all reason, and it isn’t over yet
After they had lost three of their first four games the format of this tournament seemed bizarrely charitable, contriving to offer them hope of still qualifying for the semi-finals
